prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Defences to Claims for Breach of Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: A defendant may successfully challenge a claim for breach of confidential business information on the grounds that:
there is no relationship of confidentiality;
the information was not disclosed improperly or without authority; or
the plaintiff has not suffered any damages.

It may also be argued that there are public policy reasons for the dissemination of the confidential business information that outweigh the potential damage to the plaintiff or that preclude the plaintiff from its claim as a result of the expiry of a limitation period, laches or acquiescence.
